poem:
Title: "Of Sharks and Shallows"

A hue of blue on man's domain,
Respect, not fear, curbs our disdain.
In Cornish tides, a shark's swing takes,
Mankind, just toys in salty lakes.
No puppy's genuflection here,
Through prism of water, emerges fear.
Yet we plunge in the realm of the pristine,
Testing the margins of the unseen.
